title: Mint.com Headline font. Friendly fat- serif Font
content:
Any ideas on what this font is or where it can be purchased?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140525064401im_/http:/typophile.com/files/mint-money_3516.jpg)
author: LogoType

comments.content:
it's seems to be the font bienvenue, created by Jean François Porchez for the french phone opérator france télécom. This is an exclusive corporate type et musn't be use for others than france télécom. I am also dissapointed by this because I love this font and because france Télécom have stop to used it for a while. Sorry for my english

a link  
 [http://www.typofonderie.com/alphabets/view/Bienvenue/?lang=en](http://web.archive.org/web/20140525064401/http:/www.typofonderie.com/alphabets/view/Bienvenue/?lang=en "http://www.typofonderie.com/alphabets/view/Bienvenue/?lang=en")
I see, so use at my own risk! What about something similar? What do your recomend as a similar substitute?

You could always try [Costa](http://web.archive.org/web/20140525064401/http:/www.typofonderie.com/alphabets/view/CostaPTF) or [Parisine Plus](http://web.archive.org/web/20140525064401/http:/www.typofonderie.com/alphabets/view/ParisinePlus), both are also typefaces from [Porchez Typofonderie](http://web.archive.org/web/20140525064401/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Porchez%20Typofonderie).

\> _I see, so use at my own risk!_

Rather -- do _NOT_ use. :^/
